page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY SCRAPTOFT
page.content: Scraptoft village has a Scandinavian name,but it is not known if there was an Anglian settlement there before 'Scrapi'arrived at the time of the Danish invasions. The village is mentioned in the Domesday Book,a copy of which is to be found in All Saints Church.At this time the manor belonged to the newly founded priory at Coventry. Nowadays Scraptoft is much less spoiled than most of the peripheral villages.The church is typical of East Leicestershire,i.e.ironstone fabric with limestone dressings and built round about 1300.The church has some monuments to the Wigleys who lived at the adjacent hall which is now part of the Polytechnic.Stained glass windows commemorate the Corah family and depict St.Margaret.This is used as a trade mark on clothes made by the firm
